net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.constraint

Class ConstraintPropagator

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.constraint.ConstraintPropagator

  • public class ConstraintPropagator
extends Object

    A constraint propagator used to simplify expressions found in guard/action blocks.

    The constraint propagator is initialised with a list of formulas understood as a conjunction of constraints, and a context providing values bound to symbols and ranges of variables. It attempts to simplify these constraints to produce a simpler list of expressions.

    The constraint propagator is not complete. It can handle equality substitutions, some linear arithmetic, and some Boolean normalisation. More complex formulas, for example involving disjunctions or non-linear arithmetic, are not simplified.

    The basic usage pattern of the constraint propagator is as follows.

      ModuleProxyFactory factory = ModuleElementFactory.getInstance();
  CompilerOperatorTable optable = CompilerOperatorTable.getInstance();
  ConstraintPropagator propagator =
    new ConstraintPropagator(factory, optable, context);
  propagator.addConstraints(constraints);  // load constraints
  propagator.propagate();  // simplify
  ConstraintList result = propagator.getAllConstraints();  // get result
    Author:
    Robi Malik

        public ConstraintPropagator(ModuleProxyFactory factory,
                            CompilerOperatorTable optable,
                            VariableContext root)
        Creates a new constraint propagator.
        Parameters:
        factory - Factory used to create expressions.
        optable - Operator table to provide operators.
        root - Context providing values of bound symbols and ranges of EFA variables.

                            CompilationInfo compilationInfo,

        optable - Operator table to provide operators.
        root - Context providing values of bound symbols and ranges of EFA variables.

      • ConstraintPropagator

        public ConstraintPropagator(ConstraintPropagator propagator)
        Duplicates a constraint propagator. This constructor creates a new constraint propagator, which is initialised to exactly the same state as the given constraint propagator. It has the same context and starts with the same bindings and formulas.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(ConstraintList clist)
        Initialises this constraint propagator. This method clears any constraints and bindings, and replaces them by the contents of the given list.
        Parameters:
        clist - New list of constraints to replace previous state.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets this constraint propagator. This method clears all constraints and bindings.

      • addConstraints

        public void addConstraints(ConstraintList clist)

        Adds the given constraints to this constraint propagator.

        This method does not clear any constraints or bindings already present. It merely adds the new constraints to its list unprocessed constraints, further restricting the present state.

        The additional constraints are not automatically simplified. To simplify, propagate() should be called.

        Parameters:
        clist - List of constraints to be added.

      • addConstraints

        public void addConstraints(Collection<SimpleExpressionProxy> constraints)

        Adds the given constraints to this constraint propagator.

        This method does not clear any constraints or bindings already present. It merely adds the new constraints to its list unprocessed constraints, further restricting the present state.

        The additional constraints are not automatically simplified. To simplify, propagate() should be called.

        Parameters:
        constraints - List of constraints to be added.

      • addConstraint

        public void addConstraint(SimpleExpressionProxy constraint)

        Adds the given constraint to this constraint propagator.

        This method does not clear any constraints or bindings already present. It merely adds the new constraint to its list unprocessed constraints, further restricting the present state.

        The additional constraint is not automatically simplified. To simplify, propagate() should be called.

        Parameters:
        constraint - Constraint to be added.

      • addNegation

        public void addNegation(ConstraintList clist)
                 throws EvalException

        Adds the negation of the given constraint list to this constraint propagator.

        This method does not clear any constraints or bindings already present. It merely adds the new constraint to its list unprocessed constraints, further restricting the present state.

        The additional constraints are not automatically simplified. To simplify, propagate() should be called.

        Parameters:
        clist - List of constraints to be negated and added. If the constraint list contains multiple constraints in conjunction, this results in a disjunctive constraint added to this constraint propagator.
        Throws:
        EvalException

      • addPrimedVariables

        public void addPrimedVariables(Collection<SimpleExpressionProxy> constraints)
        Adds all primed variables in the given expressions to this constraint propagator. This adds variables to the constraint propagator without adding constraints, in order to ensure the output mentions these variables using equalities such as x'==x'.

      • addPrimedVariables

        public void addPrimedVariables(SimpleExpressionProxy constraint)
        Adds all primed variables in the given expression to this constraint propagator. This adds variables to the constraint propagator without adding constraints, in order to ensure the output mentions these variables using equalities such as x'==x'.

      • removeVariable

        public void removeVariable(IdentifierProxy varName)
        Removes the given variable from the constraint propagator. This method deletes any bindings associated with the variable in its primed and unprimed form, and removes the variable from the set of primed variables. This will remove all equations mentioning the variable from the constraint propagator output.
        Parameters:
        varName - The name of the variable to be removed, without prime.

      • removeUnchangedVariables

        public void removeUnchangedVariables()
        Removes unchanged primed variables from this constraint propagator. This method checks for primed variables with bindings that are equal to the current values of the variables, and removes them. This suppresses equations of the form x'==x in the output, provided that x' does not appear elsewhere.

      • propagate

        public void propagate()
               throws EvalException
        Simplifies the current set of constraints. This method attempts to simplify the given set of constraints under the current bindings as much as possible. It applies all available simplifications rules until no further simplification is possible. It changes the state of the constraint propagator to reflect any changes, and the results can be retrieved using the methods isUnsatisfiable(), getAllConstraints(), and getContext().
        Throws:
        EvalException

      • isUnsatisfiable

        public boolean isUnsatisfiable()
        Returns whether the current set of constraints has been found to be false.
        Returns:
        true if it has been found that the given constraints cannot be simultaneously true in the current context. Otherwise false is returned, indicating the the constraints may be simultaneously true, or it is not known whether they are satisfiable.

      • getAllConstraints

        public ConstraintList getAllConstraints()
                                 throws EvalException

        Returns a constraint list representing the current state of this constraint propagator. The returned list of expressions describes all constraints given as formulas as well as any inferred range constraints, as concisely as possible.

        This method calls getAllConstraints(boolean) with the pretty argument set to true.

        Returns:
        List of constraints, or null if the current constraints have been found to be unsatisfiable.
        Throws:
        EvalException

      • getAllConstraints

        public ConstraintList getAllConstraints(boolean pretty)
                                 throws EvalException
        Returns a constraint list representing the current state of this constraint propagator. The returned list of expressions describes all constraints given as formulas as well as any inferred range constraints, as concisely as possible.
        Parameters:
        pretty - Whether enumeration constraints should be shortened using inequalities. For example, if a variable x can take all values from a ten-valued enumeration except b or c, this may be represented as x != b & x != c.
        Returns:
        List of constraints, or null if the current constraints have been found to be unsatisfiable.
        Throws:
        EvalException

      • getContext

        public VariableContext getContext()
        Retrieves the constrained variable context. This method returns a variable context that results from constraint propagation. It may contain additional bindings or ranges that are further constrained than in the original context.

      • isAtomicValue

        public boolean isAtomicValue(SimpleExpressionProxy expr)
        Returns whether the given expression represents a literal value (integer constant or enumeration member) in the current context of this constraint propagator.

      • getNumberOfInvocations

        public int getNumberOfInvocations()
        Returns the number of times the propagate() method of this constraint propagator has been called since its creation.

      • getLogger

        public org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger getLogger()
